required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BLOSSOM: Behavioral Modification and Lorcaserin Second Study for Obesity Management
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-Week, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Lorcaserin Hydrochloride in Overweight and Obese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the weight loss effect of lorcaserin during and at the end of 1 year of treatment in overweight and obese patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group assessment of the effects of lorcaserin hydrochloride during 52 weeks of administration to overweight or obese male and female volunteers aged 18 to 65 years inclusive.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Co-primary Endpoint- Proportion (%) of Patients Achieving > or = 5% Weight Loss From Baseline to Week 52
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more after 52 weeks. Other co-primary endpoints are change from baseline in body weight (kg) at year 1 and the proportion of patients achieving ≥ 10% reduction in body weight at year 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The % change in body weight (kg) from baseline to week 52.

arm_group.description: Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and placebo tablet each evening
Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and evening
Matching placebo tablet each morning and evening

intervention.description: Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and placebo tablet each evening for a duration of 52 weeks.
Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and evening for a duration of 52 weeks.
Matching placebo tablet each morning and evening for a duration of 52 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overweight and/or obese men and women with a body mass index (BMI) 30 to 45 kg/m2 with or without a comorbid condition (e.g., hypertension, dyslipidemia, CV disease, glucose intolerance, sleep apnea), or 27 to 29.9 kg/m2 with at least one comorbid condition.
- Ability to complete a 1 year study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Diabetes mellitus (type I, II or other)
- History of symptomatic heart valve disease
- Serious or unstable current or past medical conditions

outcome.title: Co-primary Endpoint- Proportion (%) of Patients Achieving > or = 5% Weight Loss From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more after 52 weeks. Other co-primary endpoints are change from baseline in body weight (kg) at year 1 and the proportion of patients achieving ≥ 10% reduction in body weight at year 1.

measure.title: Co-primary Endpoint- Proportion (%) of Patients Achieving > or = 5% Weight Loss From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more after 52 weeks. Other co-primary endpoints are change from baseline in body weight (kg) at year 1 and the proportion of patients achieving ≥ 10% reduction in body weight at year 1.

outcome.title: Percent Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: The % change in body weight (kg) from baseline to week 52.

measure.title: Percent Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: The % change in body weight (kg) from baseline to week 52.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Bladder cancer stage I, with cancer in situ

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication of study results are only allowed with prior written consent from Arena Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
